headline.main: Bush Speaks of Security To Group of U.S. Attorneys

lead_paragraph: Following is an excerpt from President Bush's remarks yesterday at a conference of United States attorneys in Washington, as provided by the White House: On the home front, terrorist violence must be prevented and must be defeated. And it will be, with vigilance, aggressive investigation and certain punishment. Already, we've committed significant new resources to homeland security. We've improved our ability to detect and stop terrorist activity. But we've still got a lot of work to do.
abstract: Excerpt from Pres Bush's remarks to United States attorneys explaining need for military tribunals in terrorism cases (M)
